vehicles.description: Several cars and trucks are visible on both sides of the road, parked or possibly in slow movement due to construction activities or congestion.
vehicles.explanation: Parked or slow-moving vehicles could make abrupt movements, such as pulling out into traffic or opening doors, which affects the traffic flow and might require evasive actions.

barriers.description: Possible visual barriers caused by the stationary vehicles obstructing line of sight
barriers.explanation: These barriers may hide other road users or ongoing construction work, requiring the ego car to be prepared to react to unseen hazards as they become visible.

suggestions: The ego car should reduce speed and be prepared to stop or navigate around the construction area and parked vehicles, maintaining a vigilant watch for any sudden changes in the traffic pattern or for workers and other road users that might emerge from blind spots caused by the stationary vehicles. The use of hazard lights might be appropriate if stopping or slowing considerably, and the car should follow any directions provided by construction signs or workers.
